Archetype.short_description: Primordial pattern or template that structures thought and meaning.

Form.short_description: Essential nature or pattern underlying instances of thought.

Concept.short_description: Abstract or generic mental representation of phenomena.

Universal.short_description: Idea or principle that applies across all instances of a category.

Category.short_description: Fundamental classification system for organizing thought.

Principle.short_description: Foundational rule or law governing relationships and processes.

Paradigm.short_description: Framework of thought that structures understanding and interpretation.

Noumenon.short_description: Thing-in-itself beyond sensory perception or empirical knowledge.

Logos.short_description: Underlying rational principle or divine thought structuring reality.

Schema.short_description: Mental framework organizing and interpreting information.

Essence.short_description: Fundamental nature or quality defining a thing's being.

Meme.short_description: Self-replicating unit of cultural information or idea.

Symbol.short_description: Representative form carrying deeper meanings and associations.

Pattern.short_description: Recurring structure or organization in thought and phenomena.

Ideal.short_description: Perfect or transcendent model of which things are copies.

Law.short_description: Fundamental principle governing relationships and behavior.

Abstraction.short_description: Mental isolation of qualities from particular instances.

Metaphor.short_description: Framework for understanding one domain in terms of another.

Axiom.short_description: Self-evident truth forming basis for reasoning.

Dialectic.short_description: Process of thought development through opposition and synthesis.

Intuition.short_description: Direct apprehension of truth without conscious reasoning.

Doctrine.short_description: Systematic framework of taught principles or beliefs.

Gnosis.short_description: Direct spiritual knowledge or insight into reality.

Maya.short_description: Structuring power of thought creating apparent reality.

Nous.short_description: Divine or cosmic intelligence/mind underlying thought.

Wisdom.short_description: Deep understanding of fundamental principles and their application.

Truth.short_description: Fundamental reality or validity underlying appearance.

Logic.short_description: System of valid reasoning and relationship between ideas.

Vision.short_description: Comprehensive mental image or understanding of possibility.

Narrative.short_description: Organizing structure giving meaning to events and ideas.

Gestalt.short_description: Unified whole that determines meaning of constituent parts.

Mythos.short_description: Organizing story or narrative framework for meaning.

Consciousness.short_description: Awareness within which all ideas and experience arise.

Mind.short_description: Field or faculty generating and containing thought.

Thought-form.short_description: Distinct pattern or structure in mental substance.

Imagination.short_description: Creative faculty generating new combinations of ideas.

Memory.short_description: Storage and recall system for ideas and experiences.

Reason.short_description: Faculty for logical analysis and connection of ideas.

Understanding.short_description: Grasp of meaning and relationship between ideas.
